Hello Kerbonauts !

I've been playing KSP sporadically for a few months already, been loving it a lot ! But every play session would suck me in and consume all my night time. I've mostly been playing around with the career mod each new version, but had a severe relapse a few weeks ago after watching Interstellar ;o

I've known the joy of the first Mun landing, I've figured out how to rendez-vous thanks to the save XXXXX Kerman from Kerbin's orbit, docking scares me and I haven't dared trying it yet but I'll get there...

And to finish, a screenshot of Jeb going full rodeo re-entry on his way back home, saved by Chuck Kerman after he got himself stuck on the Mun due to a rather brutal landing he miraculously survived !

Switch to "Surface" mode earlier, and kill your horizontal velocity.

(In layman's terms, point in the opposite direction you are going relative to a surface, and burn until you are falling straight down instead of sideways).

If you time it right you'll be right on top of your target.

If not, just tilt toward the target and burn to start moving, then in the other direction to fall down again.

The closest I've gotten (I could get closer if I had the fuel and time) was within 100 meters.
